properties.DESCRIPTION: Potentially far-travelled in valleys draining volcano
properties.DEFINITION: Lahars are hot or cold mixtures of water, from melted snow, ice, and rock fragments that flow down the slopes of a volcano and typically enter river valleys. A moving lahar looks like a roiling slurry of wet concrete, and as it rushes downstream, the size, speed, and amount of material carried can constantly change.
properties.WHATTODO1: Listen carefully to official reports via emergency broadcasts.
properties.WHATTODO2: If officials warn of an approaching lahar, seek high ground off the valley floor as quickly as possible, such as moving up a hillside. Then, seek shelter.
properties.WHATTODO3: Stay out of valleys and low-lying areas that lead away from the mountain.

properties.DESCRIPTION: Lava, pyroclastic flows, thick tephra, lahars, ballistic ejecta, and rock fall
properties.DEFINITION: On and close to the flanks of stratovolcanoes, you may be exposed to falling ash and volcanic rocks, lava flows, lahars, volcanic gases, and fast-moving torrents of hot rock and gas (pyroclastic flows).
properties.WHATTODO1: Move away from hazard zones as fast as possible.
properties.WHATTODO2: Your route to safety might be cut off. If you are on a snow and ice covered volcano. Stay off valley floors and out of low-lying areas - lahars may occur.
properties.WHATTODO3: Pay attention to closure signs; they can save your life.

properties.DESCRIPTION: Lava flows from vents dispersed between major volcanoes
properties.DEFINITION: Lava flows are streams of molten rock that pour or ooze from an erupting vent.
properties.WHATTODO1: Follow evacuation advice from officials.
properties.WHATTODO2: Stay off fresh lava flows - burning vegetation releases methane gas, which can accumulate in covered areas and be released as an explosion.

properties.DESCRIPTION: Post-lahar sedimentation
properties.DEFINITION: After lahars have passed and the emergency is largely over, river valleys with volcanic debris will continue to shed and disperse large volumes of sediment downstream. This sediment chokes streams, reducing the amount of available storage of rivers and reservoirs.
properties.WHATTODO1: Be aware that lahar sediments will be remobilized by rain and normal river drainage for years after a volcanic event, which may result in destructive flooding.
